nodes.bodyText: Is this change really necessary?
Yes, we had to change the PanelType specifically for the Runtime. We didn't want to possibly break generated panels in Business Central. See the class RuntimePerspectiveEditorActivity
Could this test be broken into more specific (and shorter) tests?

Consider declaring these variables as class-scoped constants.
I see them being repeatedly declared/used on other methods.
Please add copyright header to this file.

I'd be better to split this class into a View and a Presenter. Then, the logic below could be moved to the Presenter.

This is causing the page to reload after the upload, right? Can we avoid such a behavior?
From a UX perspective, I think we should have a way to load the file right away on the current screen instead of reloading the entire page.

Yes, otherwise it would make the UI stuck in some of the navigation drag components

Null check here is not needed.
See this comment -> #956 (comment)

It seems that onPlugInAdded and onPlugInSaved share the same content.
Consider creating a common method that they can use, thus avoiding code duplication.

Should we check here if pluginsLoaded == true first?

I have to agree but this code was a refactor from PerspectivePluginManager. We had to re-implement the behavior of this class in Runtime, so I had to extract and interface out of it and add a specific implementation in Runtime! Hence why I didn't modify any of the original code to avoid breaking stuff in other webapps
[1] https://github.com/kiegroup/appformer/blob/master/dashbuilder/dashbuilder-client/dashbuilder-navigation-client/src/main/java/org/dashbuilder/client/navigation/plugin/PerspectivePluginManager.java#L147
This value is in KB but the property must be set in MB, right?
It should be in KB - export models without big CSVs inside it would always be <100kb
I'd remove this comment and the other below.
You can simplify this code with ifPresent.
Another option here would be FilenameUtils#getBaseName.
You can reuse the deleteFile method here.
Is it a TODO?

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * Parses a exported zip file from Transfer Services into RuntimeModel.
          
          
            
             * Parses an exported zip file from Transfer Services into RuntimeModel.

This code seems fragile, i.e., can we rely on this expected path structure?
Another thing, does it work on Windows OS?

The path is retrieved from a file supposedly exported from BC or Dashbuilder. In these cases the directory structure would have to follow zip entry specification, see in [1]:
       4.4.17.1 The name of the file, with optional relative path.
       The path stored MUST NOT contain a drive or
       device letter, or a leading slash.  All slashes
       MUST be forward slashes '/' as opposed to
       backwards slashes '\' for compatibility with Amiga
       and UNIX file systems etc.  If input came from standard
       input, there is no file name field.  

So it should use forward slash.
However, DataTransferServices should be tested on Windows environment. But bear in mind that unfortunately it is broken on Windows, see [2]. Once [2] is solved we should revisit this topic to make sure that exported files in Windows will work with runtime, hence I created [3].
[1] https://pkware.cachefly.net/webdocs/casestudies/APPNOTE.TXT
[2] https://issues.redhat.com/browse/RHPAM-2751
[3] https://issues.redhat.com/browse/AF-2520
